item.description:
We are pleased to welcome Ben Einstein, who heads Brainstream, a local 
firm which designs, engineers and creates innovative products. 
  
Ben has worked on many aspects of product development from concept 
initiation and refinement to prototyping and small-scale production to 
full-scale manufacturing. At Brainstream, Ben focuses on projects that 
fuse technology & user interaction and is responsible for daily 
operations. 
  
His work has been discussed in numerous publications including CNBC, 
The Robb Report, Maxim, CNET, Stuff.tv, This Old House, The Telegraph, 
Gizmodo, Cult Of Mac, Car & Driver Magazine, Playboy Magazine and on 
NPR. His extensive work in assembly and CNC machining optimizes design 
for production-oriented product development. He holds a Bachelors 
degree from Hampshire College focusing on Product Design and 
Development. 
  
Ben's newest dream is the development of an old factory building in 
Holyoke into a center for innovation, including a idea which is called 
Maker College, where millions of dollars in tools would be available 
to members at a very LOW cost! Maker College also includes a startup 
program, which would be availble to help ALL of us develop ideas into 
programs and bring them to market - at low cost and high speed! 
  
This is one meeting that you will not want to miss! Bring your friends 
and contacts - new for 2011 - no cost for non-members (the public) to 
attend! 
  
Web Site: www.brainstreamdesign.com 
 
 
 
Note: Public meetings are now absolutely free (we used to ask for a $5 contribution).  
So bring everyone you can think of!
item.name: April Public Meeting with Ben Einstein
